name: kreplach
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in Jewish cooking, a boiled or fried ball of dough (= flour mixed with water and fat) that is filled with meat or cheese and often put in soup: The chicken was served in a broth that also had noodles, kreplach, peas and carrots in it. Popular in Jewish cooking, kreplach are often compared to the wontons found in Chinese cuisine.
More examplesFewer examples In many Ashkenazi Jewish homes, kreplach are served on Rosh Hashanah or during the pre-fast meal before Yom Kippur.My first time eating kreplach was when my friend invited me to his family's seder.
